reg_pit.acttitle: South Coast British Columbia Transportation Authority Act
reg_pit.title: Greater Vancouver Transit Conduct and Safety Regulation

change.changenote: Section 1 definitions of "fare paid zone", "tariff", "transit employee", "transit property" and "transit vehicle" BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 187/2012, effective September 4, 2012.

definition.def: means any transit property to which access is restricted by sign to those persons who possess proof of payment;
means the applicable fare structure from time to time established by the authority;

paragraph.paragraphtext: the authority,
a subsidiary of the authority,
an agent or contractor of the authority, or
an agent or contractor of a subsidiary of the authority;

definition.def: means property that is used to provide transit services and that is owned or controlled by

paragraph.paragraphtext: the authority,
a subsidiary of the authority,
an agent or contractor of the authority, or
an agent or contractor of a subsidiary of the authority;

definition.def: means any vehicle operated by or on behalf of the authority or one of its subsidiaries for the transportation of passengers, goods or both.

change.changenote: Section 1 definitions of "ancillary structure", "electronic component" and "fare gate" were added by BC Reg 110/2017, effective March 27, 2017.
Section 2 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 187/2012, effective September 4, 2012.

section.sectiontext: Sections 3, 4 and 8 (1) to (3) (h) do not apply to transit employees acting in the course of duty.

change.changenote: Section 3 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 187/2012, effective September 4, 2012.

section.sectiontext: A person boarding a transit vehicle that is not a fare paid zone must

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the presence of a transit employee pay the fare required by the tariff, or
present proof of payment to a transit employee.

change.changenote: Section 4 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 187/2012, effective September 4, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: A person entering a fare paid zone must

paragraph.paragraphtext: pay the fare required by the tariff and obtain proof of payment, or
possess proof of payment.

subsection.subsectiontext: A person must, while in a fare paid zone, retain the proof of payment and produce it for inspection at the request of a transit employee.

change.changenote: Section 5 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 76/2022, effective March 30, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not use a proof of payment unless it was purchased for his or her use at the fare required of him or her by the tariff.

change.changenote: Section 8 (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 261/2012, effective September 7, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: place any object or obstacle on or in a track, dock, bridge, guideway, tunnel, road or right of way used by a transit vehicle,
damage, tamper with or remove any equipment or device on a transit vehicle or transit property,
prevent or interfere with the operation of a transit vehicle,
in a transit vehicle, occupy any place not intended for public use,
impede a transit employee in the operation of a transit vehicle,
prevent or delay the closing of a transit vehicle door,
extend or project any part of the person's body or any object through the window of a transit vehicle, or
ride or stand on or hold onto the exterior of a transit vehicle.

change.changenote: Section 8 (4) was added by BC Reg 110/2017, effective March 27, 2017.
Section 8.1 was enacted by BC Reg 261/2012, effective September 7, 2012.
Section 8.1 (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 76/2022, effective March 30, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: otherwise wilfully obstruct, interfere with, impede, molest or hinder the fare officer in exercising his or her powers or in carrying out his or her duties or functions under the Act.

change.changenote: Section 9 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 187/2012, effective September 4, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: A person who contravenes section 3, 4 (1) or (2), 5 (2) or 7 (a) or (c) or 8 (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine not exceeding $150.

change.changenote: Section 9 (4) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 261/2012, effective September 7, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: A person who contravenes section 5 (3), 7 (b) or 8 (1) or (3) (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g) or (h) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine not exceeding $500.

change.changenote: Section 9 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 110/2017, effective March 27, 2017.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 5 (2) or 7 (a) or (c) or 8 (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine not exceeding $150.
